TextAsset.value: (Lolo asked me to meet her here at the cafe…
I gotta admit, I’m pretty nervous.
There she is, sitting at one of the tables…
It looks like she’s writing something on her napkin?)
Hey, ${slot:playerName}.
Whatcha got there?
Nothing!
Don’t look at it!
It’s just a dumb doodle!
I didn’t know you liked to draw.
I don’t! Not really…
We used to draw a lot at the shrine, when I was practicing to be a priestess.
It’s pretty stupid…
I bet nobody remembers that now.
Even though it was kinda important to me…
Or at least I thought it was.
Well… okay.
I won’t force you to let me look at it.
...This place is pretty cool, isn’t it?
I come here sometimes… People read poetry. It’s actually kind of neat.
Haha, yeah.
I’m glad I had free time so I could come and meet you here!
(It meant a lot to me that she even invited me…
I wonder what it means?)
Heh. Yeah.
I’m actually supposed to be in yearbook club right now.
But they won’t notice that I skipped.
Nobody notices me anyway.
Lolo-!!
(No- I shouldn’t say anything…
It seems like something is kinda different today.
I don’t want to make her feel like I’ll just get mad if she talks to me.)
I just wanted to see you, I guess…
I wanted to tell you… about Klonoa.
(This is it…
This is the one from her past I’ve heard her talk about so much…
Am I finally going to find out what happened to Lolo…
To make her think that the world is an awful place, where nothing matters?
I don’t want her to have to feel like that…)
He was always nice to me, but…
He made me realize that no one would ever care about me.
He didn’t mean to do it, but people who are really lucky like that-
Like him, and like you-
They never really get it, you know?
Haha, what am I saying.
Of course you don’t know.
“Lucky”?
What do you mean?
How am I lucky?
You know… you never have to worry about…
Being ugly.
Or that your feelings are…
Heh. That you don’t have feelings at all.
Why are you telling me about this now?
Did something happen?
Well, kinda.
I just figured…
Like you said, I could get expelled for cheat codes.
So in case that happens… I should tell you what I’m thinking about.
(I kinda get the feeling that she’s not going to try to enter a cheat code anymore.
Maybe she just needed an excuse to talk to me…
Whatever the case, I’ll take it.)
Okay.
Did I show you this picture of Klonoa and me?
Notice anything about it?
Just that…
You look a little happier.
And that makes me kinda sad.
Well, I was pretty dumb then.
But no… in that picture, you can see why-
Why being around Klonoa made me feel like…
It isn’t worth it to try.
… Uh… I don’t really get it.
It’s…
it’s my ears.
I hate looking at them…
(Ohhh… her ears.
Of course.
I was wondering what Lolo could possibly thing was ugly and unlovable about herself…
Poor thing… I think her ears are cute, but of course she’d think they were too big-)
They’re so SMALL!
(...Or not.)
I mean, look at Klonoa!
His ears are HUGE!
They’re AMAZING!
My ears will never, ever be that big. I’m just stuck that way, so...
I’m just gross and ugly, and there’s nothing I can do about it.
Lolo, no!
Please don’t say that about yourself…
I mean, look at me!
...What about you?
I have no ears at all!
Do you think I’m ugly?
...It’s different…
You’re you.
Did Klonoa make you feel bad about your ears?
No! Never. Well, not on purpose.
I don’t think he ever thought about it.
So… that’s it?
That’s why you started thinking that nothing mattered…
Not even your own life?
Because you thought your ears were too small?
You don’t seem like the type to put so much stock in how you look...
I mean, I’m really sorry that it hurt you so much...
But it’s sorta… hard to believe.
Heh…
I know what you mean.
I guess you’re right…
The ear thing is something I felt bad about for a long time.
But, I stopped caring about stuff like that.
Even if nobody could ever like me because of my ears…
It doesn’t matter anyway.
People always fall apart anyway.
Friends who mattered so much to you forget you existed.
Maybe it’s better to avoid all that.
But you’re not ugly!
You’re you, and you're....
You’re, well, really pretty.
Please…
You don’t have to say anything corny.
I know you’re the wholesome type who probably thinks everyone is beautiful on the inside.
Even if you really mean it, all that cutesy stuff gets tiring after a while.
Um…
Sorry.
The truth is…
It’s even more pathetic than what I just told you.
You’ve been looking for the big thing that made me stop caring, right?
Like maybe you think Klonoa broke my heart, and I learned to see the world as a cruel place, or something.
Er… I guess so.
Well, nothing like that happened. My heart’s not broken.
The truth is…
There is no "big thing" that happened.
One day, I woke up…
And I just started feeling this way.
I’d go to practice my priestess duties, and for the life of me I couldn’t remember why I wanted to.
I’d look around and just think it all felt so hopeless.
Even Klonoa, who I liked so much…
I started to act really cold around him.
I didn’t even have a reason why.
It was just how I was starting to be.
A little more each day.
And when he left...
I mean, I missed him. But it didn’t matter as much as I thought it would.
And what’s worse, I didn’t care that it didn’t matter.
I was losing my memories of my friend, losing what I cared about…
And it didn’t feel any different to me…
Than it would have if I hadn’t.
And there was no reason for any of it. I’m just broken, I guess.
I talk all the time about how sad it is that friends drift apart and stop caring…
But the truth is, I’m the one who did that. To Klonoa, and to my fellow priestesses.
I drifted away from them, and for no reason at all.
And to be honest….
The fact that I did that…
It’s kind of more of a relief than anything else.
Lolo…
I don’t know what to say.
I know. It’s pathetic, right?
That’s how I know…
That things in this life really are meaningless.
Because there isn’t even any meaning to how I feel.
It’s all for nothing.
Which means it could happen to anyone, even a happy person like you…
And it also means… there’s nothing I can do to fix it.
Because there was no real problem in the first place.
So when people try to say nice things to me, to get me to snap out of it-
It felt even worse than if they’d said nothing at all.
They never understood how deep it went.
Lolo, I’m so sorry…
All this time, I thought...
I don’t need you to be sorry.
I just feel like…
Like no one understands me.
But I thought maybe…
Jeez, this is hard to say.
I dunno how you can say corny stuff all the time and not explode.
I thought...
Maybe you might be different?
Lolo…
What do you mean?
I thought maybe…
Maybe you might understand…
What I’m feeling right now. If you know what I mean.
(“What she’s feeling”?
What DOES she mean?
I wish she wouldn’t be so vague all the time…
I guess she must be talking about how she thinks life is meaningless and stuff.)
I’m sorry, Lolo.
I wish I could feel the same way…
I’ve just never felt that the way you do.
I don’t want you to feel bad…
But I don’t like to lie, you know?
Hah…
(Whoah!
She looks like she’s on the verge of tears…
What?!)
Typical…
Of course it happens like this.
I don’t know why I expected anything different…
Every time I think I can’t get hurt anymore, I get proved wrong.
Sorry… for wasting your time.
Don’t worry about me…
It doesn’t matter anyway.
Whoa, what?
Lolo, wait-
Don’t just walk out of the cafe-
(Too late… she’s gone.
Sigh…
I don’t really understand what happened just there.
I told her how I felt about that stuff before, didn’t I?)
Pac-Man?!
It’s good to see you, but what are you doing here?
Be true to yourself.
Huh? What do you mean?
(Pac-Man is tapping on the table where Lolo was sitting…
What is that?
It’s… Lolo’s napkin?
The one she was drawing on before?
Let’s see what’s written here…
Oh.
It’s a heart…
With a little drawing of me.)
When you’re young, even the smallest feelings feel much bigger than they are.
That’s what Lolo is going through right now…
But that doesn’t mean those feelings aren’t real.
She’s got to be true to them, and herself… and so do you.
(Oh. So when she asked me if I felt the same…
She wasn’t asking if I thought things were meaningless…
She was asking if…
Oh.
Ohhh.
Wow… I’m an idiot.)
Pac-Man… It might be too late to be true to myself now…
I might have already messed it up!
But thank you… I’ll try my best to fix it.
Good luck, ${slot:playerName}!
(That Pac-Man always knows what to say…
I’ve got to find Lolo.
I hope I’ll see her tomorrow…)
